meanings.sent1: After the long hike, I felt ravenous and devoured my sandwich in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The wolf looked ravenous as it eyed the deer in the clearing.
meanings.sent3: I was so ravenous that I even considered eating the burnt toast.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were ravenous, scanning the buffet like a hawk.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies made me feel ravenous.

meanings.sent1: The young artist was ravenous for praise after finishing her painting.
meanings.sent2: He was ravenous for knowledge and read every book he could find.
meanings.sent3: The detective was ravenous for clues to solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was ravenous, always seeking new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The crowd was ravenous for entertainment, cheering loudly for the performers.

meanings.definition: Consuming or craving food in great quantities
meanings.sent1: The ravenous raccoons knocked over the trash cans looking for food.
meanings.sent2: The party guests were ravenous, quickly finishing all the appetizers.
meanings.sent3: The ravenous toddler demanded more cookies, refusing to eat anything else.
meanings.sent4: The ravenous crowd at the food festival tried every dish available.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the barbecue made everyone feel ravenous and eager to eat.
